name: Avoid using embedded CSS in Web Pages (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all PHP Files that are not linked to a style sheet(*.css) and contain hardcoded style definition. Style sheets (*.css) should be used instead of hardcoded style definition.
output:
This report lists all PHP Files with hardcoded style definition and no link to a style sheet.

This QR provides the following information:
PHP File  full name.
rationale: Using style sheets (*.css) instead of hardcoded style definition improves redeability and is less costly to maintain.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of web pages with hardcoded style definition and no link to a style sheet(*.css).
